greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: 58 consecutive function values of the prime generating polynomial P(x) = (1/72)*x^6 + (1/24)*x^5 - (1583/72)*x^4 - (3161/24)*x^3 + (200807/36)*x^2 + (97973/3)*x - 11351. Abs(P(n)) is prime for -45 <= n < 12.
comment: As of 2014, this is the polynomial with rational coefficients that produces the most primes for a contiguous region of n. It was found by François Dress and Bernard Landreau, see the publication linked below. The complete list of 58 values is provided as b-file.
link: Hugo Pfoertner, Table of n, a(n) for n = -45..12
François Dress and Bernard Landreau, Polynômes de degré supérieur à 2 prenant beaucoup de valeurs premières, arXiv:1402.7312 [math.NT], 28 Feb 2014.
xref: Cf. A121887, A330364 (absolute values sorted by size).
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Dec 12 2019
